Contact Us

Take the Right Action

  • If you’re in immediate danger: Call 999 or your local emergency number.
  • Talk to someone: A trusted friend, family member, teacher, or support worker can help.
  • Document evidence: Keep a record of abusive messages, injuries, or controlling behaviours, if safe to do so.
  • Know your rights: You have the right to feel safe, respected, and heard. Legal help and protective orders may be available.
  • Use Safe Spaces: Pharmacies and banks across the UK offer private areas for immediate support. Look for the “Safe Space” symbol.
  • Make a safety plan: Plan safe places to go, people to contact, and items to take if you need to leave quickly.
  • Seek help online: Use the Bright Sky app or live chat services if it’s not safe to speak aloud.

    • GUARDSUP: Guide, Understand, Act, Respond, Detect, Support, Uphold, Protect.
